intro: Raphionacme velutina, commonly known as velvetleaf, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of the Americas. It is characterized by its broad, heart-shaped leaves that are covered in a fine, velvety texture. The plant produces small, inconspicuous greenish-white flowers arranged in clusters. It is often found in disturbed areas such as roadsides and agricultural fields. Raphionacme velutina is known for its ability to thrive in a variety of soil types and its tolerance to both drought and shade.
